Articles.Content:
I've been trying to break the sound barrier below 300m. I am using the FAR mod for superior aerodynamics and my thinking is that its causing the problem. The thing is that parts start falling of the aircraft when approaching 300m/s. Mainly the tail part and following that I loose control of the jet.

Am I doing something wrong? Or is it some kind of game limit?

Thank you.

This is the aircraft in question.
I know it doesn't alway look the best but you might consider running some struts. AFAIK struts don't have mass/drag but do add strength.

Mass yes, drag no iirc.

Are you losing parts because of violent manoevering? might want to fiddle with the FAR damping settings.

Mass yes, drag no iirc.

Are you losing parts because of violent manoevering? might want to fiddle with the FAR damping settings.

I dont think so. I keep the jet really stable to avoid speed loss and then all of sudden things start flying of. Its like the parts cant handle the drag.
hmm, Aerodynamics havent really been implemented. Id say NEEDS MOAR DUCTAPE!

It's like the parts can't handle the drag.

This is probably exactly what is happening. Parts under stress in FAR will break off, it is part of the mod.
I've been suffering this too, I hope more realistic aerodynamics will come soon. Having parts of my wing randomly flying off isn't particularly realistic

So I think that I've figured it out. It seems that the Mk1 cockpit overheats once I reach 305+m/s. The thing is that I am measuring the temperatures and they are not even close to the 3400 that are listed in descriptions of the cockpit =(

I use the Graphotron to measure temperatures. I hit around 600 degrees when things start exploding.

Edited April 29, 2013 by xclusiv8

I've been suffering this too, I hope more realistic aerodynamics will come soon. Having parts of my wing randomly flying off isn't particularly realistic

FAR introduces a very excellent model of aerodynamics to the game, which the OP stated he was using in his first post. Also, wings fall off airplanes in real life. I fail to see how wings falling off while attempting to go supersonic would be "unrealistic".
